lead_paragraph: Warming temperatures can dry out northern peatlands, increasing the risk of fires that release thousands of years of stored carbon into the atmosphere.

headline.print_headline: A Keeper  of Carbon Is at Risk
headline.main: As Peat Bogs Burn, a Climate Threat Rises

snippet: Warming temperatures can dry out northern peatlands, increasing the risk of fires that release thousands of years of stored carbon into the atmosphere....
abstract: Peat bogs, which play significant role in carbon storage, are being threatened by climate change; warming temperatures can dry out bogs, which then become susceptible to wildfires that can release tons of carbon; some 1.6 million square miles are defined as peatland, about 3 percent of the earth’s land surface, lying mostly in northern latitudes in Canada, Alaska, Europe and Russia.
